title: Skill test before you can play ranked.
body:
Ok so i was sitting here prepping to start a training regime (hour of custom games a day where i do nothing but practice various skills) so i can break out of bronze when i started to realise just how beneficial a skill test would be to ranked play.

For one itd create a skill barrier that would effectively eliminate that elo void we call sub 100mmr (ive dipped there a few times, seen horrifying things, like titanic hyrdra ashes and runaans huricane xin zhaos. it truly is a sight to behold i must admit)

But thats not why i think it should exist, weve all heard the salty summoner qq about shit teams (infact most of my threads are just that) but the much more important thing that a skill test would provide, is a chance to improve.

We all know straight up that half the reason people are stuck in bronze or silver is they dont actually know what they are lacking in.

I sat down and realised that while my map awareness is near godlike (https://www.reddit.com/r/summonerschool/comments/2mlzuy/how_to_really_improve_at_league_of_legends_not/ i scored 100 points on the map awareness test on that, meaning my map awareness is basically challenger level) my csing and all around mechanics are trash tier, like i mean, super trash tier, not even good enough for norms trash tier.

If there was a ranked skill test id have realised these flaws a very very long time ago, and most likely knowing myself have repeated the tests over and over until i got a perfect score even if it took me months.

This would not only improve the play at lower echelons of elo, itd bring forth a new generation of high level players who could likely continue to improve upwards into the lcs area (unlikely but hey, that bronze player with the weird build ideas might be godlike if he knew how to actually play said builds.)

Something else this would do is reduce the toxicity level in ranked. while yes we would still have trolls trickling in, due to the fact that most players would actually be half decent and would also know their flaws and limitations we would have less instances of the riven that thought they could be just went afk instead.

Frankly i dont expect such a system to be put in place because well "rito pls" but you never know this might be just a fresh enough take on the age old "force people to pass a test first" idea that they might reconsider.

oh and fyi im aware id most likely fail the tests, but thats the point, to create motivation to actually improve instead of just raging in b5.

replies.body: I disagree with this, no matter how many plebs think they're ready for ranked as soon as they hit level 30, they all have a right to play ranked whether we more skilled players like it or not. The MMR system will eventually place them where they belong and they will climb once their personal mechanics have improved, but until Riot designs a better ranking system we all just have to accept the fact that there are players out there who are worse than us.

The point of the test is not to create a skill barrier but to point out which skills are lacking.

As i mentioned in the my original post most of the people in bronze, myself included are not in bronze because we are incapable of learning.

But rather because we had no idea where we were shit in the first place.

As an example the reason my map awareness is so bloody good is ive spent the last 6 months focusing on that and pretty much nothing else.

As i was convinced thats where i was lacking.

Turns out this was the complete opposite as map awareness is my strongest skill apparently.

Had i known this months ago from some form of skill test i wouldve moved on to practicing more beneficial skills like csing.

As was stated in the link i posted you can spend one day going from a 0 level skill to a 40 or 50

Or you could spend a week going from a 50 to a 60

Which is better to spend your time on? knocking out all the 0 level skills, or perfecting the ones you already have for less benefit and overall slower progress.

To put it another way, if i was putting the same effort i put into my map awareness, in the skills i actually needed to work on? who knows i couldve been diamond by now, but i had no idea.

Another way to look at this is, bronze players most crucial skill we are lacking.

Is the ability to drop our egos, and asses our own skills to find our weaknesses, this is something you cannot attain through natural practice as to be able to asses yourself skillwise you must first have the skills you are assessing, or the age old adage, practicing doesnt make perfect, practicing perfection makes perfect, or in otherwords in order to get better at a skill you must know what that skill is how it works, why you cant do it, how to do it etc etc, sure you can use critical analysis to breakdown a skill, but we see time and time again that this is subpar to being told how the skill works, then taking that information and applying it practically so you can get firsthand understanding.

But that doesn't stop you from taking on constructive criticism (the ego part does but the inability for self assessment doesn't)

Ummmmm, not sure about that test thing. The link I went to just showed a list of points you would get based on how often you look at the mini-map. So you just looked at the 100 point one and said "yep that's me"?

To get 100 points you have to get all the prior steps.

You dont just get 100 points for checking the minimap after every cs, you have to actually use the information from the minimap and understand it.

To put it in content, there is a bloody good reason i have only been succesfully ganked three times in the last 100 hundred games.

And it isnt because im some faker level god mechanics wise, hell my kda ratios show im shit at the game, but if there is any one thing i excel at its map awareness.

_

Also that was just one of the examples, theres a list of about 40 skills there that doesnt even scratch the surface, the entire test concept is to make you aware of what you are good at, and what you arent so you can direct your practice attempts, i just so happen to be very good at map awareness and shit at everything else.

I digress the point of this post wasnt to brag about my map awareness, i was just using that as an example of how if i had known i was that good at map awareness through some sort of testing procedure i wouldnt have spent so much of my time perfecting it when i couldve worked on something else like csing.

The idea of self testing just does not work though.
You can read through those points and say 'yeh I do that, I do that, I do that', but in game, when you don't notice that vi walk passed the edge of a ward in your jungle, how can you judge yourself on something you don't notice? It just doesn't work. Of you don't notice your own shortcomings you cannot possibly judge yourself on it

you dont quite seem to get it.

I do notice that vi walk past the edge of a ward.

Ive been a sniper for battlefield titles for the last 10 years, i have the ability to notice fine details and movement like that, its a skill that directly translates to map awareness in mobas.

That and i have my map so big on my screen its kinda hard to not notice that big ass red circle pop up for half a second.

Further more i didnt just read it and go "yep yep yep" i played like 20 games recorded them all, watched the replays back checked my reactions and also used my youtube equipment to record my actual face during said games then compared the results to the test.

regardless ive already proven my point, and weather you want to get that through your skull or not is your own decision.
